org.apache.ctakes.core.resource

Class FileLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ctakes.core.resource.FileLocator

  • public final class FileLocator
extends Object
    Utility class that attempts to locate files.
    Author:
    Mayo Clinic

      • getAsStream

        public static InputStream getAsStream(String location)
                               throws FileNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        location - some string representing the full or partial location of a file
        Returns:
        an input stream for the file
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if no file could be found

      • locateFile

        public static File locateFile(String location)
                       throws FileNotFoundException
        Where a Stream is usable, use getAsStream(String) . Where a path String is usable, use getFullPath(String) .
        Parameters:
        location - some string representing the full or partial location of a file
        Returns:
        a File if successfully located
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if no file can be located

      • locateFile

        public static File locateFile(Class<?> clazz,
                              String location)
                       throws FileNotFoundException
        Where a Stream is usable, use getAsStream(String) . Where a path String is usable, use getFullPath(String) .
        Parameters:
        clazz - some class whose classloader should be used
        location - some string representing the full or partial location of a file
        Returns:
        a File if successfully located
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if no file can be located

      • getFullPath

        public static String getFullPath(String relativePath)
                          throws FileNotFoundException
        Attempts to discover the real location of a file pointed to by relativePath. The search will be performed in the following order:

        1. By checking to see if the provided relative path is actually an absolute path 2. By checking within the ClassPath 3. By checking directly under the current working directory 4. By checking under $CTAKES_HOME 5. By traversing above the current working directory. Useful when running under a module directory in an IDE Example: cwd = /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin/ctakes will be checked for containment of the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned 6. By traversing above the current working directory and under a subdirectory ctakes/ Example: cwd = /usr/bin/my_custom_ctakes/my_ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin will be checked for containment of ctakes/ plus the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned

        Parameters:
        relativePath - some relative path to a file
        Returns:
        the canonical path of the file or the absolute path of the file if the canonical cannot be made
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found

      • getFullPath

        public static String getFullPath(Class<?> clazz,
                                 String relativePath)
                          throws FileNotFoundException
        Attempts to discover the real location of a file pointed to by relativePath. The search will be performed in the following order:

        1. By checking to see if the provided relative path is actually an absolute path 2. By checking within the ClassPath 3. By checking directly under the current working directory 4. By checking under $CTAKES_HOME 5. By traversing above the current working directory. Useful when running under a module directory in an IDE Example: cwd = /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin/ctakes will be checked for containment of the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned 6. By traversing above the current working directory and under a subdirectory ctakes/ Example: cwd = /usr/bin/my_custom_ctakes/my_ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin will be checked for containment of ctakes/ plus the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned

        Parameters:

        relativePath - some relative path to a file
        Returns:
        the canonical path of the file or the absolute path of the file if the canonical cannot be made
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found

      • getFullPathQuiet

        public static String getFullPathQuiet(String relativePath)
        QUIETLY Attempts to discover the real location of a file pointed to by relativePath. The search will be performed in the following order:

        1. By checking to see if the provided relative path is actually an absolute path 2. By checking within the ClassPath 3. By checking directly under the current working directory 4. By checking under $CTAKES_HOME 5. By traversing above the current working directory. Useful when running under a module directory in an IDE Example: cwd = /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin/ctakes will be checked for containment of the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned 6. By traversing above the current working directory and under a subdirectory ctakes/ Example: cwd = /usr/bin/my_custom_ctakes/my_ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin will be checked for containment of ctakes/ plus the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned

        Parameters:
        relativePath - some relative path to a file
        Returns:
        the canonical path of the file or the absolute path of the file if the canonical cannot be made

      • getFullPathQuiet

        public static String getFullPathQuiet(Class<?> clazz,
                                      String relativePath)
        QUIETLY Attempts to discover the real location of a file pointed to by relativePath. The search will be performed in the following order:

        1. By checking to see if the provided relative path is actually an absolute path 2. By checking within the ClassPath 3. By checking directly under the current working directory 4. By checking under $CTAKES_HOME 5. By traversing above the current working directory. Useful when running under a module directory in an IDE Example: cwd = /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin/ctakes will be checked for containment of the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned 6. By traversing above the current working directory and under a subdirectory ctakes/ Example: cwd = /usr/bin/my_custom_ctakes/my_ctakes-module , relativePath = ctakes-other-module/more/file.ext The directory above cwd /usr/bin will be checked for containment of ctakes/ plus the relative path If /usr/bin/ctakes/ctakes-other-module/more/file.txt exists then that is returned

        Parameters:
        clazz - some class whose classloader should be used
        relativePath - some relative path to a file
        Returns:
        the canonical path of the file or the absolute path of the file if the canonical cannot be made
